{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328116,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T20:49:54.081Z","cooked":"

We are using MK4i L2, CANCoders, Pigeon 2, and NEOs, teleop is working fine however autonomous is being completely Random. I create a path “auto 100” which tells it to go a foot forward and instead it starts going full speed with random rotations and then eventually stops after like 6 seconds.

Video of the issue: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w2OlPfVgzx0

Code can be found here
https://github.com/frc6548/2024-swerve-drive-base

Also after deleting autos and paths from Pathplanner they don’t delete in my autonomous selector.

image3839×2159 330 KB

image1920×1080 86.3 KB

Eric1:

/

Are you setting the start pose for your path?

From the PP docs

Warning

This method will load all autos in the deploy directory. Since the deploy process does not automatically clear the deploy directory, old auto files that have since been deleted from the project could remain on the RIO, therefore being added to the auto chooser.

To remove old options, the deploy directory will need to be cleared manually via SSH, WinSCP, reimaging the RIO, etc.

Eric1:

GitHub - frc6548/2024-swerve-drive-base

Just opened your code on PP, looks like your autonomous is not have a preset starting pose. To change this, go to your auto100, click the starting pose drop down, check the box, and it should allow you to move around a starting position, and give it the same position and angle as your starting pose for your path

You were totally right, after simulating it was an issue of not having a starting point. Reformatting my roborio cleared the paths too.

Now I am getting this issue, the translation looks okay but the rotation is totally whack. Maybe a PID issue? I have messed with the pidcontrollers in module.java a ton but it just seems to make it worse. If anyone has a good way of tuning pid or some good starting pid values that would be sweet.

Idk why sim pid would be such different from the real though so maybe a dif issue?

Path:

image2560×1440 309 KB

Video of the issue

Code we’re using for this different robot:

GitHub

Reformatting is a long way around to clear pathplanner files from the roborio. You need a program like Filezilla which allows you to connect with the rio, then find and delete the files. Its something you should learn to do.
Why are you doing square moves with swerve drive? You should make that first path end at the second path endpoint and have a waypoint in between if needed.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-10T21:53:10.186Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457946,"topic_slug":"autonomous-issues","display_username":"icemannie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28240,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/autonomous-issues/457946/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329335,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T22:07:13.396Z","cooked":"

This path is just a test to see if the robot follows the path correctly. Which it didn’t.

We can just wait until a day before competition and reformat to make it easier to find the right path at competition.
